PackageIntroduction

Source: vignettes/PackageIntroduction.Rmd
PackageIntroduction.Rmd
library(dataCleaner)
library(printr)
library(dplyr)
tibble::tibble(
  date = c("20190101", "20190305", "20201012"),
  numeric_val = c(1, NA, 5),
  char_val = c("", "val ", "-")
) -> sample_table

sample_table
date numeric_val char_val
20190101 1
20190305 NA val
20201012 5 - 
sample_table %>% 
  clean_frame
DATE CHAR_VAL NUMERIC_VAL
2019-01-01 NA 1
2019-03-05 val NA
2020-10-12 NA 5 
sample_table %>% 
  fill_na(where(is.numeric))
date numeric_val char_val
20190101 1
20190305 0 val
20201012 5 -

Pivot summary

Transpose a tibble of summary statistics in tidy format.

Can transpose 1 row numerical summaries by default.

iris %>% 
  summarize(across(where(is.numeric), mean), .groups = "drop") %>% 
  pivot_summary()
column V1
Petal.Length 3.758000
Petal.Width 1.199333
Sepal.Length 5.843333
Sepal.Width 3.057333

A grouped summary can be transposed by providing the name of the group column.

iris %>% 
  group_by(Species) %>% 
  summarize(across(where(is.numeric), mean), .groups = "drop") %>% 
  pivot_summary(Species)
column setosa versicolor virginica
Petal.Length 1.462 4.260 5.552
Petal.Width 0.246 1.326 2.026
Sepal.Length 5.006 5.936 6.588
Sepal.Width 3.428 2.770 2.974

Supports transposing numerical summaries with multiple groups using tidyselect.

iris %>%
  mutate(Species1 = sample(Species)) %>%
  group_by(Species, Species1) %>%
  summarize(across(where(is.numeric), mean), .groups = "drop") -> multigroup_summary
 
multigroup_summary
Species Species1 Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width
setosa setosa 5.078947 3.531579 1.510526 0.2842105
setosa versicolor 4.975000 3.381250 1.500000 0.2250000
setosa virginica 4.946667 3.346667 1.360000 0.2200000
versicolor setosa 5.835714 2.814286 4.242857 1.3285714
versicolor versicolor 5.920000 2.660000 4.233333 1.2866667
versicolor virginica 6.014286 2.819048 4.290476 1.3523810
virginica setosa 6.582353 2.917647 5.600000 1.9764706
virginica versicolor 6.447368 2.984211 5.426316 2.0842105
virginica virginica 6.785714 3.028571 5.664286 2.0071429

Group names are concatenated and pivoted.

multigroup_summary %>% 
   pivot_summary(matches("Spec"))
column setosa_setosa setosa_versicolor setosa_virginica versicolor_setosa versicolor_versicolor versicolor_virginica virginica_setosa virginica_versicolor virginica_virginica
Petal.Length 1.5105260 1.50000 1.360000 4.242857 4.233333 4.290476 5.600000 5.426316 5.664286
Petal.Width 0.2842105 0.22500 0.220000 1.328571 1.286667 1.352381 1.976471 2.084211 2.007143
Sepal.Length 5.0789470 4.97500 4.946667 5.835714 5.920000 6.014286 6.582353 6.447368 6.785714
Sepal.Width 3.5315790 3.38125 3.346667 2.814286 2.660000 2.819048 2.917647 2.984211 3.028571
